Articles.Content:
It's happened a few times now. I've set up maneuver points, executed the burn, and suddenly the orbital path indicators go haywire. Everything settles down if I add a bit of "warp" but when I come out of warp and then try to fire engines, or turn sas on and off...nothing. Engine and sas control stops responding. Happens when I go back to the last save point as well.

I've confirmed that my warp time is 1 as well when I try to make course changes or fire engines/engage sas.

Anyone have a clue as to why? Noticed it happens on Minimus as well when I take a rover out for a test drive to see how it handles. Get to a certain point and poof...no more control over vehicle...
Did you run out of power? Probe command pods require electricity to control anything.
I've had the same happen with a few of my ships. I have no idea what causes it, but leaving to the space center and then coming back to the flight seems to fix it.
DOH! Thanks endless....unmanned pods ran out of juice. Such a simple thing....easy to miss.

DOH! Thanks endless....unmanned pods ran out of juice. Such a simple thing....easy to miss.
I think this happened to the most of us
Yes, to avoid this, always add at least a power generator. Rockets and jets make electricity when they are on.
